entities.description: A procedure used in statistical analysis for generating estimates in NSDUH data.
A software used for data management, statistical analysis, and graphics.
A software used for advanced analytics, multivariate analysis, business intelligence, data management, and predictive analytics.
A software used for the statistical analysis of correlated data.
A nesting variable used in NSDUH data to capture explicit stratification and to identify clustering.
A nesting variable used in NSDUH data for capturing the primary sampling unit.
A statement used in SUDAAN procedures to define variance stratum variables.
A statement used in SAS procedures to define variance stratum variables.
A statement used in SAS procedures to list variable VESTR_C and VEREP.
Represents the degrees of freedom in NSDUH data, essential for calculating variance estimates.
A method used by the SURVEYMEANS procedure in SAS for variance estimation.

relationships.description: NSDUH uses the SUDAAN software for statistical analysis.
NSDUH uses the SAS software for data analysis and estimates.
NSDUH uses the Stata software for data management and statistical analysis.
The NEST statement in SUDAAN procedures defines the variance stratum variable VESTR_C.
The NEST statement in SUDAAN procedures lists the primary sampling unit variable VEREP.
The STRATA statement in SAS procedures includes the variance stratum variable VESTR_C.
The CLUSTER statement in SAS procedures lists the primary sampling unit variable VEREP.
The procedure SURVEYMEANS in SAS uses the Taylor linearized variance estimation method.
The NSDUH data includes specific degrees of freedom for calculating variance estimates.
The NSDUH data uses the VESTR_C variable for explicit stratification and identifying clustering.
The NSDUH data uses the VEREP variable for the primary sampling unit.
